summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 discussing a psychological review of inmates at a correctional facility, specifically mentioning the review of inmates on psychological observation and suicide risk assessments. It appears to be internal administrative communication regarding inmate mental health protocols.

events.title: Psychological Review Completion
events.description: Central office staff reviewed Psychological Data System (PDS) reports, noting two inmates on psychological observation and none on suicide watch, and reviewed 16 Suicide Risk Assessments (SRAs) from the last month. They identified patterns for future training and specific cases to follow up on with institution staff.

events.title: Request for Psychological Review
events.description: A request was made for a psychological services employee to contact the NYM Chief Psychologist or Acting Chief to review each inmate currently on watch, recently on watch, or on Psych Alert, ensuring proper evaluation, housing, and documentation.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 11-13, 2019, discussing psychological reviews of inmates.
Central office staff reviewed the Psychological Data System (PDS) and identified two inmates on psychological observation with none on suicide watch.
Sixteen Suicide Risk Assessments (SRAs) conducted on 11 inmates over the last month were reviewed, with patterns identified for future training.
The email references a request to contact the 'NYM Chief Psych or Acting Chief' to ensure proper evaluation and documentation for inmates on psychological watch or alert.
The correspondence appears to be routine administrative communication regarding inmate mental health protocols, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein or specific case details.
